* for f in /some/dir/*; do xxx; done
* git config --global credential.helper cache
* git config credential.helper 'cache --timeout=3600'  # for a particular repo, must use it in a git repo, but the effect is global
	- in minutes
* crontab
	- crontab -e
		* format: f1 f2 f3 f4 f5 program
f1: minutes
f2: hours
f3: day
f4: month
f5: weekday
program: excutable
examples:
	0 */2 * * * echo "xxx" >> /tmp/a.txt # every 2 hours
	0 23-7/28 * * * # every 11 in everning to 8 in money every 2 hours. Wrong??
	* * * * 1-3	# Monday to Wensday
	- service crond restart
	- crontab -l

* git log
* if has /usr/sbin/installkernel than can use:
	`make modules_install install`
	to install kernel
* v3.12-rc7 release candidate
* git checkout #checkout a branch or paths to the working tree
	`git checkout -b [tag name]`

* the process to build a custom kernel
        git clone git://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/stable/linux-stable.git 
        cd linux-stable 
        git tag -l | less 
        select the latest tag(not rc) 
        git checkout -b [tagname] 
        git clone git://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git 
        cd linux 
        configure: 
                use /boot/config-`uname -r`*.config to .config 
                or use default config: 
                        make defconfig 
                or make menuconfig 
                or make nconfig 
        make 
        or make -jX where X is 2 or 3 for dual core, 4 or 6 for quad core. 
        sudo make modules_install install(because of /usr/sbin/installkernel 
        sudo grub2-mkconfig
